The reason for this answer is that being Deaf may not necessarily hinder an individual's ability to successfully navigate the housing application process. While it may present some challenges, such as difficulty with phone or in-person interviews, many Deaf individuals are able to communicate effectively through written means, such as email or text messages. Additionally, many housing applications involve written forms or online portals, which can be more accessible for Deaf individuals who may not be able to hear oral instructions.
